label: A5BC2_mC64_15_5f_f_2f-001
title: Y$_{2}$SiO$_{5}$ (RE$_{2}$SiO$_{5}$ X2) Structure
comments:
Compounds of the form RESiO$_{5}$ (RE = Rare Earth and related elements) crystallize in one of two forms (Wang, 2001 and Tian, 2016): 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B5C_mP32_14_2e_5e_e-001}{X1, space group $P2_1/c$ \#14, for rare earths between lanthanum and gadolinium}, and X2, this structure, for the later rare earths. Dysprosium, yttrium and ytterbium compounds exist in both structures. 
 This is the high temperature phase of Y$_{2}$SiO$_{5}$. Below 1190$^{\circ}$C it transforms into the X1 phase. 
 The ICSD entry is from (Michel, 1967).
